page.title: 10THE "CULTIVATED" CANNICH
page.content:
Very little{grain}is grown and what there is, barley and oats, is used for feeding cattle and sheep in Winter and Spring. Silage and Hay are also made for winter keep.
Very few{root crops}are grown. Some rape (not oilseed rape) is grown for fattening lambs in the Autumn. Potatoes are not grown commercially.
Not one farm is self-sufficient where winter keep is concerned. If animals are to be fed properly, animal feed concentrates, hay or barley straw have to be purchased.
{Arable Farming}in Cannich area is certainly not a good commercial prospect with regard to{cultivation.
